meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a crinkled or puckered texture.
meanings.sent1: The dress was made of soft plisses that felt bumpy to the touch.
meanings.sent2: She loved the plisses of the skirt because they added a unique texture.
meanings.sent3: The plisses on the pillow made it look like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The plisses of the blanket resembled the ripples on a calm lake.
meanings.sent5: The plisses on the curtains caught the light in a beautiful way.

meanings.definition: To create a crinkled or puckered texture in fabric by folding and pressing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully plisses the fabric to give it a textured look.
meanings.sent2: Plissing the edges of the tablecloth added a decorative touch.
meanings.sent3: He plisses the paper to make it look like a crumpled ball.
meanings.sent4: The artist plisses the clay to create a unique pattern.
meanings.sent5: Plissing the ribbon gives it a lovely, crinkled appearance.

meanings.definition: A series of pleats or folds in fabric.
meanings.sent1: The plisses on the skirt gave it a stylish and elegant look.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate plisses on the collar of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The plisses on the napkin made it look like a fancy restaurant setting.
meanings.sent4: The plisses on the tablecloth added a touch of sophistication to the table.
meanings.sent5: The plisses on the drapes created a beautiful cascading effect.
